meanings.definition: An expression of disgust or distaste.
meanings.sent2: Yech, I don't like the taste of mushrooms.
meanings.sent3: Yech, this milk smells like old socks!
meanings.sent4: The spoiled food in the fridge made the whole kitchen smell like yech.
meanings.sent5: The slimy texture of the snail left a yech feeling in my mouth.

meanings.sent1: She yechs every time she sees a spider.
meanings.sent2: Please don't yech at the dinner table.
meanings.sent3: He yeched loudly when he tasted the bitter medicine.
meanings.sent4: The sight of the rotten fruit made her yech uncontrollably.
meanings.sent5: The foul smell from the garbage can always makes him yech.

meanings.sent1: The leftovers in the fridge turned into a yech.
meanings.sent2: The swamp was full of yechs like slimy algae.
meanings.sent3: The mystery meat in the cafeteria was a real yech.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned house was a yech of decay and neglect.
meanings.sent5: The public restroom was a yech of filth and unpleasant odors.
